abstracts.cdata!:
The broader policy objective of this
            Financial Sector Adjustment Loan Project is to assist the
            Guatemalan Government to implement its Financial Sector
            Reform Program, aimed at bringing about a stronger and
            better functioning banking sector, aboe to withstand
            external shocks and to increase prudent lending to the
            private sector, opening access to groups and enterprises
            today largely excluded from bank financing. The program
            supported by this operation includes actions in the
            following key areas: 1) reform of the monetary policy legal
            framework for the conduct of monetary and financial policy,
            including the capitalization of the Central Bank; 2) reform
            of the financial sector legal framework aimed at:
            strengthening the regulation of financial groups and
            creating an orderly market exit mechanism, enhancing credit
            risk management, and increasing access to financing; 3)
            reform of bank supervision legal framework aimed at
            strengthening the autonomy of the Superintendency of Banks
            and its legal and institutional capacity to supervise
            financial groups, and raising banking sector regulation upto
            international standards; 4) enactment of legislation to
            prevent money laundering to reduce illegal actvities and
            comply with international norms; and 5) consolidation of the
            banking system through the restructuring or closure of
            insolvent banks, and through mergers and acquisitions.
